entry.value: Input table containing the column with m/z values

Metanode for DIA (data independent acquisition) method windows generation based on the provided nonredundant list of observed m/z values and potentially also ion mobility values.%%00010%%00010The m/z list should be ideally non redundant to get better windows placing. I.e. there should be single m/z value for each peptidoform (unique combination of peptide sequence, set of modifications and charge state).%%00010%%00010The metanode calculates DIA windows using the provided list of observed m/z values, it splits them into equally sized chunks based on the number of requested DIA windows and the DIA windows are calculated based on individual m/z chunks.%%00010%%00010M/z range to cover can be specified either using the concrete m/z range (e.g. 400-1000) or via percentile value (e.g. 0.9) to cover from the provided list of m/z values. Percentile value is used to filter out the same part from both ends of the provided m/z list, e.g. 5% for the percentile of 0.9.%%00010%%00010Ion mobility information from the provided exports is used to optimize the IM range placing in case of more ion mobility steps (only 2 ion mobility steps are implemented at the moment). It is checked whether the two im intevals overlap; if not, the found IM thresholds are used directly, otherwise, the compounds from the overlapping IM range are got from the input data, their median IM value is calculated for both intervals and the two median value average is used as the splitting point.%%00010%%00010The generated DIA windows are exported into the specified file, the extension is set automatically based on the DIA windows scheme type.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010Python 3 (The Python consists of the following Python 3.6 License. Licence terms are available here: https://docs.python.org/3.6/license.html)%%00010Python package Pandas (The Pandas consists of the following BSD License. Licence terms are available here: https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause)%%00010Python package Numpy (The Numpy consists of the following BSD License. Licence terms are available here: https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-3-Clause)%%00010%%00010The metanode was created in KNIME 4.6.3 running inside the docker image (https://hub.docker.com/r/cfprot/knime/), tag 4.6.3a.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010This version of metanode is available under the GNU GPL 3.0 License, unless stated otherwise. The full version of the license terms is available at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.%%00010Version: 2.1.0 from 2024-06-26%%00010Contact person: David Potesil (david.potesil@ceitec.muni.cz)%%00010More information can be found at https://github.com/OmicsWorkflows/KNIME_metanodes.
Component does not have input data, execute upstream nodes first
